garlic.name: Garlic
garlic.default: Rotten garlic is very stinky. One whiff makes you cry.

sword.name: Sword
sword.default: You feel super cool holding this sword.

home.name: House of Sacrifices
description:
by Brent Irwin
This game was initially developed as a class project. It was written in C++ for the UNIX command line. I was proud of it, but it was hard to share with my friends and family. I ported this game into JavaScript with React to solve that problem.
The story was inspired by the free Dungeons & Dragons adventure, Death House.

You find yourself in an eerie old town. The cobblestone streets are narrow and the tall buildings seem to cave in above you.
You hear a whimpering coming from a dark alley. You go to investigate adn find a small boy and girl crying outside of a dilapidated house with boarded windows. You ask what is wrong.
The boy is too frightened to talk. The girl speaks up. "We cannot go back inside," she says. "Our parents keep a monster in the basement, and they're not here. Please, our baby brother is trapped inside his room."
"Please, save our brother and stop the monster!" the small boy says.

foyer.description: You pass through the wrought iron gate and stare up at the tall house leaning over you. The door is already open. You walk inside and the heavy door slams behidn you. You try to get back out, but it is locked. You are trapped. Inside you see a tall grandfather clock. It chimes eleven times. To the west is a staircase. To the north and to the east are two closed doors.

conditions.description: You return to the vaulted, gothic foyer. The exit door is sealed shut. You see a tall grandfather clock. To the west is a staircase. To the north and to the east are two closed doors.

soft_links.action: The clock seems to be watching you. It dongs knowingly as you approach.

links.text: Take the door to the north
Take the door to the east
Go up the stairs to the west

dining.description: You enter a grand dining room. The table is set with fine crystal glasses and corroded sterling plates and silverware. A thick layer of dust covers everything. An eerie painting is displayed prominently on the wall.

action: The painting, 7 feet across, depicts a man, woman, and baby. The man is holding the baby. The woman wears a
$qDress
dress and looks displeased.

soft_links.action: On the table you find and old, rotted bulb of garlic. You take it with you.

action: The painting, 7 feet across, depicts a man, woman, and baby. The man is holding the baby. The woman wears a
$qDress
dress and looks displeased.

soft_links.action: A thick layer of dust covers the tarnished silver dinnerware.

bedroom.description: In the master bedroom stands a massive four-poster bed.

action: The bed is unmade, covered in decades of dust. Blood splatters from the white sheets to the
$qWood
headboard.

landing.description: You are on the second floor hallway. You hear a baby crying behind a door to the south. There is another door on the north wall. The spiral staircase is on the west side of the room.

conditions.description: You are on the second floor hallway. There are doors to the north and the south. The spiral staircase is on the west side of the room.

nursery_murder.description: You pull out the garlic and throw it at the ghoul. It releases a blood-curtling scream as the garlic burns through its ectoplasmic face. It dissintegrates into steam that dissipates into the air.

action: You once again approach the baby's crib. A nameplate above it says
$qName
. As you pick up the small child, you see that it is nothing but a skelton wrapped in cloth, left to decay for centuries.

nursery.description: As you open the door, the baby's screams stop. You approach the crib inside where you see a small, swaddled mass. As you bend over to look inside, you feel a presence. There before you is a ghastly nursemaid, semitransparent and rotting to pieces.

conditions.description: The floating ghoul is still there. She reaches out for you.
In the baby's bedroom, you hear nothing but your own breath.

action: You once again approach the baby's crib. A nameplate above it says
$qName
. As you pick up the small child, you see that it is nothing but a skelton wrapped in cloth, left to decay for centuries.

library.description: You enter an old library. The walls are covered with bookshelves reaching the 12-foot ceilings. A desk sits in the center.

action: On the desk you see a sheet of paper titled "SACRIFICES,
$qYear
". A list of names runs down the page next to dates hundreds of years old.

library_just_inspected.description:
You enter an old library. The walls are covered with bookshelves reaching the 12-foot ceilings. A desk sits in the center.
As you search through the books, one stands out. Nearly 6 inches thick, it is titled "Magick and Grimories". When you pull it out, a secret door opens to the east.

action: On the desk you see a sheet of paper titled "SACRIFICES,
$qYear
". A list of names runs down the page next to dates hundreds of years old.

secret_room.description: You pull back the bookcase and walk into the small secret room. Inside lies an empty chest.

conditions.description: You pull back the bookcase and walk into the small secret room. Inside lies a chest.

soft_links.action: You open the chest. Inside you find a sword. You take it with you.

attic.description: You enter an old unfinished attic. The floorboards creak, and a small trickle of water falls from a spot in the roof. With improper insulation, this attic is colder than the rest of the house. You see rain fall in the darkness beyond the cast iron bars on the windows. A dollhouse sits on the floor. On the bed are two small skeletons, dressed just like the children you met outside.

soft_links.action: Upon closer inspection, the dollhouse appears to be eerily similar to the house you are in. The rooms are laid out the same way, painted the same, and containing the same furniture as their counterparts in the room you are in now. It even has the same thick layer of dust you have seen everywhere.

Upon closer inspection, the dollhouse appears to be eerily similar to the house you are in. The rooms are laid out the same way, painted the same, and containing the same furniture as their counterparts in the room you are in now. It even has the same thick layer of dust you have seen everywhere.
You see the long-decayed skeletons of the children you just met. Is their fate already sealed?

links.text: Take the secret chute to the cellar

attic_just_discovered_chimney.description:
You enter an old unfinished attic. The floorboards creak, and a small trickle of water falls from a spot in the roof. With improper insulation, this attic is colder than the rest of the house. You see rain fall in the darkness beyond the cast iron bars on the windows. A dollhouse sits on the floor. On the bed are two small skeletons, dressed just like the children you met outside.
Leaning over the skeletons, you find that they are indeed wearing the same clothes as the children you met outside. They are the same sizes, too.
"You found us." You hear a voice from behind. You turn around to see the ghosts of Rose and Thorn.
Rose begins to speak. "Our parents sometimes lock us in our room to protect us from the monster. They say they have to keep it in the basement so that it won't escape and eat us. One day they locked us up here, and they never let us out. We heard the screams coming from the cellar every day, but we were left in here to starve. You have to slay the monster to free our souls from this curse, so that we may move on."
Thorn walks over to the dollhouse and speaks for the first time. "The fireplace in here conceals a secret path to the cellar. Please go down and save us." He reveals in the dollhouse that the chimneyway running the entire height of the house is indeed a narrow staircase. As he does so, the fireplace in the room slides open and reveals a dark passage downward.
With this, the children disappear before your eyes.

soft_links.action: Upon closer inspection, the dollhouse appears to be eerily similar to the house you are in. The rooms are laid out the same way, painted the same, and containing the same furniture as their counterparts in the room you are in now. It even has the same thick layer of dust you have seen everywhere.
You see the long-decayed skeletons of the children you just met. Is their fate already sealed?

links.text: Take the secret chute to the cellar

cellar.description: The cellar is made completely of dank, moldy flagstone. A door is on the south side of the room.

links.text: Go back up the narrow stairs

trials.description: As you approad the south door, you hear a deadly cackle. A fiendish apparition swoops down before you, blocking the way. "So you wish to pass?" it asks. "I represent the souls of all those sacrificed by the owners of this house. If you think you have what it takes to face the monster inside, you must first prove your worth. If you cannot pass my trial," it chuckles, " then too bad for you. Are you ready to begin? Once you start, there is no turning back."

conditions.description:
"Let the quiz begin!" the ghoul cackles.
What color dress does the lady of the house wear?

"Let the quiz begin!" the ghoul cackles.
The master bedframe is made of what type of wood?

"Let the quiz begin!" the ghoul cackles.
What is the baby's name?

"Let the quiz begin!" the ghoul cackles.
In what year were the last sacrifices made?

"Very good. Let's see if you can get one more," it says with determination in its eyes.

In what year were the last sacrifices made?

dungeon.description:
As you cross through the doorway, a narrow path steeply leads you down into the belly of a huge cavern situated below the town. You hear drops of water echoing in the distance. In the middle of the massive floor sits a single barely-lit brazier in the darkness. You make your way to it with nowhere else to turn.
You stare into the flames and feel the heat against the cold dampness you've grown accustomed to. Behind you, you hear a creature smack its lips exactly once. You turn around to see a hideous meat monster, gross and deformed. Long and gangly like a lizard with arms, legs, and eyes of all different shapes and sizes protruding in every direction. At the top sits a large open hole with rows of shark-like teeth. This hold moves as the monster speaks to you. Its voice raises chills up your spine.
"For decades this family served me greatly. They found me poor and decrepit. I was on the brink of death. I promised them if they would feed me the joy in a human soul that I would grant them powers beyond their wildest dreams. Myrna loved this idea. She gladly drew in the town's visitors into her private 'wine cellar' so that I could devour their happiness and gain strength. I gave her the ability to control the minds of others. She coudl just as easily lure victims into my lair as she could influence the governors of the town or the barrons sitting on their piles of gold.
"However, Ronald seemed to have a weakness. He cared too much for the children. He pretended to go along with it, but I knew. I always know. He was planning to slay me in an attempt to protect his pathetic brats. So I gave Myrna a task. She was to use her powers to convince Ronald to feed himself to me. Her power was so great that it was no problem for her. But it turns out she was weak too. After all I had done for her, a part of her broke when she was I had eaten her lover. I saw this weakness, and I ate her as well.
"This was foolish on my part, for now I have not eaten in centuries. Don't worry, puny human. It won't be painful. But I will not hesitate. You will be mine. I am starving.

nursery.description:
You thought you could outrun her twice? Think again. Or don't, because you're dead.
The ghoul grabs you by the throat. You feel her icy cold fingers sqeezing tight. You smell rotting flesh and struggle for breath as the nursemaid opens her mouth and chews into your face.
GAME OVER

sword.description:
You attempt to stab the ghoul with the sword, but it passes through it. You lean forward into the hideous creature. It grabs the sword itself and stabs you in the stomach. You fall on the ground bleeding as the nursemaid eats away your flesh.
GAME OVER

description:
.
The apparition stares you in the eyes. You are paralyzed. You try to move, but its gaze has you transfixed. You feel an evil cold rush through your body as it swoops inside you and takes over. You feel it twisting your neck from the inside until you fall dead to the cold stone floor.
GAME OVER

run.description:
You run back to the door you came in. As you  viciously pull on the handle, the door does not move one bit. It seems to have been magically sealed shut. You claw at the door until the monster opens its gaping maw and swallows your head.
GAME OVER

scream.description:
You stand paralyzed in fear as the monster approaches you. It opens its gaping maw and swallows your head.
GAME OVER

hadouken.description:
You place your wrists together, palms facing the beast. You squeeze your eyes shut and focus all your energy. "HADOUKEN!" you scream. You open your eyes and realize nothing happened. The monster is right on top of you. It opens its gaping maw and swallows your head.
GAME OVER

description:
You pull the sword out, and it takes the beast by surprise. It tries to escape, but you use the blad to pierce the odd eyes and remove the grotesque appendages. You hack and slash as the monstrosity squeals in pain. You do not stop until you are absolutely certain that it has perished.
At this point, you see dozens or even hundreds of souls rise from the ground and head toward the heavens. Before you float the souls of Rose, Thorn, and baby

. They smile at you graciously. Thorn runs forward to hug you, but he only passes through. His sister chuckles, and as they reunite, they ascend through the cavern ceiling with the rest of the spirits.
You win.
